alert.note: Alert for Big Horn; Carbon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 23 at 2:50PM MDT until June 23 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Billings has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Crooked Creek Burn Area in... Southwestern Big Horn County in south central Montana... Eastern Carbon County in south central Montana... * Until 845 PM MDT. * At 250 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Crooked Creek Burn Area. Between 1 and 1.3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Punch Bowl Creek, East Fork Dry Head Creek, Dry Head Creek. Roads impacted include Dry Head Road, East Fork Road. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Crooked Creek Burn Area. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and downstream of the Crooked Creek Burn Area. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Crow Indian Reservation. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Life threatening flooding of creeks, roads, and normally dry coulees in and downstream of the Crooked Creek Burn Area burn area is likely. In addition to the flash flooding, the heavy rains may trigger rockslides, mudslides, and debris flows in steep terrain. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
